person.persName: Robert B. Gray (Henry County farmer and hotel keeper)

body.p: A Kentucky farmer and hotel keeper. Studied law, but did not practice. Served as a Trimble County member of the Kentucky House of Representatives from 1844 to 1846. Elected and served as a Trimble County judge from 1850 to 1854. Served as Trimble County sheriff. Moved to Henry County in 1854 from Trimble County, Kentucky. Lived in Henry County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Elizabeth Barclay Gray. Father of Ben B. Gray, Mary S. Gray, Ella V. Gray, Richard L. Gray, Sarah A. Gray, Robert J. Gray, Martha E. Gray, and Lucinda B. Gray. Owned ten enslaved persons in 1860. Member of the Whig Party, and following its dissolution, became a Third Party man.
